Class TextRect

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.TextRect
public class TextRect extends Object
Text rectangle on a full-matrix sign
Author:
Douglas Lau, John L. Stanley - SRF Consulting

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compare with another text rectangle for equality. Note that an implied text-rectangle is counted as different than an explicit text rectangle of the same size to make the fillable text rectangle algorithm implemented here work correctly.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • getLineCount

      public int getLineCount()
      Get the number of lines of text on the rectangle

    • find

      public List<TextRect> find(String multi)
      Find fillable text rectangles in a MULTI string

    • fill

      public String fill(String pat_ms, List<String> lines)
      Fill text rectangles in a pattern MULTI string. This is the inverse of `splitLines`.
      Parameters:
      pat_ms - The pattern MULTI string to fill.
      lines - Text lines in order of text rectangles, padded to each rectangle's getLineCount total.
      Returns:
      The filled MULTI string.

    • splitLines

      public List<String> splitLines(String pat_ms, String multi)
      Split a MULTI string into lines based on text rectangles in a pattern. This is the inverse of `fill`.
      Parameters:
      pat_ms - The MULTI string from a message pattern.
      multi - The MULTI string to split (not pattern).
      Returns:
      Text lines in order of text rectangles, padded to each rectangle's getLineCount total.

    • calculateWidth

      public int calculateWidth(String ms)
      Calculate the width of a single line MULTI string. Note: result will be invalid if not a single line.

    • checkLine

      public String checkLine(String ms, boolean abbrev)
      Check if a MULTI line fits in the text rectangle.
      Parameters:
      ms - MULTI line (only line-valid tags allowed!).
      abbrev - If true, try to abbreviate words if necessary.
      Returns:
      Possibly abbreviated line, or null if it does not fit.
